identificationModule.briefTitle: A Phase 1 Study of NM6603 in Advanced Solid Tumors
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Phase I Study to Determine the Maximum Tolerated Dose and Evaluate Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics of NM6603 in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study is to assess the MTD and RP2D of NM6603 in adult patients with advanced solid tumors.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: This is a Phase 1, first-in-human, multicenter, open label, 3+3 dose escalation study designed to evaluate the safety profile, the maximum tolerated dose (MTD), the recommended Phase 2 dose (RP2D), the pharmacokinetic and the preliminary antitumor activity of NM6603 in patients with advanced solid tumors. The study has two parts. In Part 1, NM6603 will be administered once daily. In Part 2, NM6603 will be administered twice daily to explore the effect of twice daily dosing on the pharmacokinetic, safety and tolerability, and anti-tumor activity profile of NM6603,

armGroups.label: Dose Escalation
armGroups.description: NM6603, administered orally every day in 28-day cycles

interventions.name: NM6603
interventions.description: NM6603 is an orally available investigational small molecule indicated for the treatment of solid malignancies including, but not limited to breast, liver, pancreatic, colorectal, cervical, melanoma and lung cancers.

primaryOutcomes.measure: To determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) and recommended Phase II dose (RP2D) of NM6603 in patients with advanced solid tumors

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Efficacy of NM6603 by Objective Response Rate (ORR) via iRECIST
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From first dose of study drug to up to ~ 12 months in absence of progressive disease or unacceptable toxicity or withdrawal of consent

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Efficacy of NM6603 by disease control rate (DCR) via iRECIST
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From first dose of study drug to up to ~ 12 months in absence of progressive disease or unacceptable toxicity or withdrawal of consent

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK) of NM6603 by maximum observed plasma drug concentration (Cmax)
Pharmacokinetics (PK) of NM6603 by apparent terminal elimination half-life (t1/2)
Pharmacokinetics (PK) of NM6603 by time to maximum observed plasma drug concentration (Tmax)
Pharmacokinetics (PK) of NM6603 by area under the plasma drug concentration-time curve (AUC) from time 0 to the time of the last quantifiable concentration (Tlast) (AUC0-t)
Pharmacokinetics (PK) of NM6603 by AUC from time 0 to infinity (AUC0-∞)
Safety of NM6603 by Dose-Limiting Toxicities
Safety of NM6603 by incidence and severity of treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs)
secondaryOutcomes.description: The intensity of the event will be graded using CTCAE v5.0 criteria.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From first dose of study drug to up to ~ 12 months in absence of progressive disease or unacceptable toxicity or withdrawal of consent
